verbalisation.sentence: Mendocino Region is adjacent region Sonoma Region.

The Cabernet Franc Grape is a thing, and a wine grape.
The Cabernet Sauvignon Grape is a thing, and a wine grape.
An anjou is all of the following: something that has as body Light, something that has as color Rose and something that has as flavor Delicate, and so on (4 items).
A beaujolais is all of the following: something that has as body Light, something that has as color Red and something that has as flavor Delicate, and so on (5 items).

A zinfandel both has as color Red, and has as sugar Dry.

An alsatian wine is defined as a wine that is located in Alsace Region.
An american wine is defined as a wine that is located in Usregion.
An anjou is defined as a loire that is located in Anjou Region.
A beaujolais is defined as a wine that is located in Beaujolais Region.
A bordeaux is defined as a wine that is located in Bordeaux Region.
A burgundy is defined as a wine that is located in Bourgogne Region.
A california wine is defined as a wine that is located in California Region.
A cotes d or is defined as a red burgundy that is located in the Cotes D Or Region.
A dry riesling is defined as a riesling that has as sugar Dry.
A french wine is defined as a wine that is located in French Region.
A full bodied wine is defined as a wine that has as body Full.
A german wine is defined as a wine that is located in Germany Region.
An italian wine is defined as a wine that is located in Italian Region.
A loire is defined as a wine that is located in Loire Region.
A margaux is defined as a medoc that is located in Margaux Region.
A medoc is defined as a bordeaux that is located in Medoc Region.

A muscadet is defined as a loire that is located in Muscadet Region.
A pauillac is defined as a medoc that is located in Pauillac Region.

A sancerre is defined as a loire that is located in Sancerre Region.
A st emilion is defined as a bordeaux that is located in the St Emilion Region.
A sweet riesling is defined as a riesling that has as sugar Sweet.
A sweet wine is defined as a wine that has as sugar Sweet.
A texas wine is defined as a wine that is located in Texas Region.
A tours is defined as a loire that is located in Tours Region.
A white table wine is defined as a table wine that has as color White.
A white wine is defined as a wine that has as color White.
The following are equivalent: a dry wine, a table wine, and a wine that has as sugar Dry.
A cabernet sauvignon both has as body only Full and Medium, and has as flavor only Moderate and Strong.
A chardonnay both has as body only Full and Medium, and has as flavor only Moderate and Strong.
A chenin blanc both has as body only Full and Medium, and has as sugar only Off Dry and Dry.
A dessert wine has as sugar only Off Dry and Sweet.
An ice wine both has as body only Full and Medium, and has as flavor only Moderate and Strong.
A merlot both has as body only Medium and Light, and has as flavor only Moderate and Delicate.
A petite syrah both has as body only Full and Medium, and has as flavor only Moderate and Strong.
A red bordeaux is made from grape only the Cabernet Sauvignon Grape and Merlot Grape.
A white bordeaux is made from grape only Semillon Grape and the Sauvignon Blanc Grape.
A zinfandel both has as body only Full and Medium, and has as flavor only Moderate and Strong.
The following have as bodies only Full and Medium: cabernet sauvignons, chardonnays and chenin blancs, and so on (7 items).
The following have as flavors only Moderate and Strong: cabernet sauvignons, chardonnays and ice wines, and so on (7 items).
Chenin blancs, and early harvests have as sugars only Off Dry and Dry.
The following have as bodies only Medium and Light: chiantis, dry rieslings, and merlots.
A chianti is an italian wine.
A port is a red wine.
A sauternes is both a bordeaux, and a late harvest.
A sweet riesling is a dessert wine.
A wine is a potable liquid.
A wine grape is a grape.
The following are wines: dessert wines, early harvests, and late harvests.
The following are wine tastes: wine bodies, wine flavors, and wine sugars.
Wine colors, and wine tastes are wine descriptors.
A cabernet franc is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape the Cabernet Franc Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A cabernet sauvignon is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape the Cabernet Sauvignon Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A chardonnay is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape Chardonnay Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A chenin blanc is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape the Chenin Blanc Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A gamay is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape Gamay Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A merlot is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape Merlot Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A petite syrah is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape the Petite Syrah Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A pinot blanc is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape the Pinot Blanc Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A pinot noir is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape the Pinot Noir Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A riesling is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape Riesling Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A sauvignon blanc is defined as something that is a semillon or sauvignon blanc, is made from grape the Sauvignon Blanc Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A semillon is defined as something that is a semillon or sauvignon blanc, is made from grape Semillon Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
A zinfandel is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape Zinfandel Grape, and is made from grape at most one thing.
The following are made from grapes at most one thing: beaujolais, margaux and muscadets, and so on (9 items).
If X has as body Y then Y is a wine body.
If X has as color Y then Y is a wine color.
If X has as flavor Y then Y is a wine flavor.
If X has as sugar Y then Y is a wine sugar.
If X has as vintage year Y then Y is a vintage year.
If X has as wine descriptor Y then Y is a wine descriptor.
If X is made from grape Y then Y is a wine grape.
If any of the following relationships hold between X and Y then Y is a region: "is adjacent region" and "is located in".
A dry red wine is defined as a dry wine that is a red wine.
A dry white wine is defined as a dry wine that is a white wine.
A red bordeaux is defined as a bordeaux that is a red wine.
A red burgundy is defined as a burgundy that is a red wine.
A white bordeaux is defined as a bordeaux that is a white wine.
A white burgundy is defined as a burgundy that is a white wine.
A white loire is defined as a loire that is a white wine.
A vintage has as vintage year exactly one thing.
A wine is all of the following: something that has as body exactly one thing, something that has as color exactly one thing and something that has as flavor exactly one thing, and so on (5 items).
If X is adjacent region Y then X is a region.
If X has as vintage year Y then X is a vintage.
If X is located in Y then X is a thing.
If any of the following relationships hold between X and Y then X is a wine: "has as color", "has as wine descriptor" and "is made from grape".
The following object properties are functional: "has as body", "has as color" and "has as flavor".
The property "is made from grape" is a sub-property of "is made from fruit".
The following properties are sub-properties of "has as wine descriptor": "has as body", "has as color" and "has as flavor", and so on (4 items).
The following are different individuals: Delicate, Moderate and Strong.
The following are different individuals: Dry, Off Dry and Sweet.
The following are different individuals: Full, Light and Medium.
The following are different individuals: Red, Rose and White.
A wine body is defined as Full, Medium and Light.
A wine color is defined as Rose, White and Red.
A wine flavor is defined as Moderate, Delicate and Strong.
A wine sugar is defined as Off Dry, Sweet and Dry.
Dry is a different individual from Off Dry and Sweet.
Dry and Off Dry are both different individuals from Sweet.
X is made into wine Y if and only if Y is made from grape X.
X produces wine Y if and only if Y has as maker X.
A semillon or sauvignon blanc is defined as a wine that is made from grape only Semillon Grape and the Sauvignon Blanc Grape.
A white non sweet wine is defined as a white wine that has as sugar only Off Dry and Dry.

The following are different individuals: Bancroft, the Chateau Cheval Blanc, the Chateau D Ychem, the Chateau De Meursault, the Chateau Lafite Rothschild, the Chateau Margaux Winery, Chateau Morgon, the Clos De La Poussie, the Clos De Vougeot, Congress Springs, Corbans, Corton Montrachet, Cotturi, Danjou, Elyse, Forman, Foxen, Gary Farrell, Kalin Cellars, Kathryn Kennedy, Lane Tanner, Longridge, Marietta, Mc Guinnesso, the Mount Eden Vineyard, Mountadam, the Page Mill Winery, Peter Mccoy, Puligny Montrachet, the Santa Cruz Mountain Vineyard, Saucelito Canyon, Schloss Rothermel, Schloss Volrad, Sean Thackrey, Selaks, the Sevre Et Maine, St Genevieve, Stonleigh, Taylor, Ventana and Whitehall Lane.
Year1998 is year value 1998.
A wine is made from grape at least one thing.
A wine is located in a region.
A white loire is made from grape only the Pinot Blanc Grape, the Chenin Blanc Grape and the Sauvignon Blanc Grape.
A wine has as maker only a winery.

A meritage is defined as something that is a wine, is made from grape only the Cabernet Sauvignon Grape, the Cabernet Franc Grape, the Petite Verdot Grape, Malbec Grape and Merlot Grape, and is made from grape at least two things.
An ice wine is defined as something that is a dessert wine, is a late harvest, and has as color White.
A wine descriptor is defined as something that is a wine color, or is a wine taste.
No early harvest is a late harvest.
If X is year value Y then Y is a positive integer.
If X is year value Y then X is a vintage year.
The property "is located in" is transitive.
The property "is adjacent region" is symmetric.
